intro: Pupulinia shuarii, commonly known as the Shuarii pupulinia, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and has adapted to grow in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
